adjective.description: (of a road or place) so crowded with traffic or people as to hinder freedom of movement.
examples: one of the most congested airports in the world
the streets are often heavily congested with traffic

adjective.description: (of a part of the body) abnormally full of blood.

origin: Late Middle English (as congest in the sense heap up, accumulate): from Latin congerere heap up, from con- together + gerere bring.
